answers.answer: no baby just hit a growth spurt more than likly you will measure fine in a couple weeks
No. My last 2 visits I was measuring 2cm over what my week was. I went Wed and I measured 1cm over.

Not necessarily. Baby's sizes and dates can vary at each visit and that's usually normal. If your uterus is measuring bigger, that can indicate that your uterus may have more than normal amounts of amniotic fluid. They can do an ultrasound to confirm whether it's extra fluid or the size of the baby. Depending on your stage in pregnancy, if you have gestational diabetes, that can cause you to have a large baby for gestational age.Hope this helps!

question: So if your measuring bigger than your suppose to does that mean your babys due date will be moved up?
title: measuring big
